question: Who is Paul writing to in this letter (Philemon 1)?
Besides Philemon, who else is mentioned in the salutation of this letter (Philemon 1-2)?
What does Paul say he always does for Philemon (Philemon 4)?
What has Paul heard about Philemon that causes him to thank God (Philemon 5)?
choice: His love and faith toward the Lord Jesus and all the saints

question: What does Paul desire regarding Philemon's faith (Philemon 6)?
choice: That his faith becomes more private
That the fellowship of his faith may become effective in the knowledge of every good thing which is in us in Christ Jesus.
That his faith may be a witness to only a few
That his faith may grow weak

question: What has refreshed the hearts of the saints, according to Paul (Philemon 7)?
What does Paul choose to do, instead of commanding Philemon (Philemon 8-9)?
choice: To write a letter of request
To appeal to him for love's sake

question: How does Paul describe himself in verse 9 (Philemon 9)?
choice: Paul, the aged, and a prisoner of Jesus Christ

question: Who is Onesimus in relation to Paul (Philemon 10)?
What does Paul say Onesimus was formerly to Philemon (Philemon 11)?
What does Paul say Onesimus is now to both Philemon and Paul (Philemon 11)?
What is Paul doing with Onesimus (Philemon 12)?
How does Paul describe Onesimus when sending him back to Philemon (Philemon 12)?
Why did Paul want to keep Onesimus with him (Philemon 13)?
choice: To punish him for his wrongdoings
That he might serve Paul in his chains for the Good News on Philemon's behalf
To use him as a personal assistant
To keep him away from Philemon

question: Why didn't Paul keep Onesimus without Philemon's consent (Philemon 14)?
choice: That Philemon's goodness would be of free will, and not as of necessity
Because Onesimus did not want to stay
Because he knew Philemon would come get him

question: What does Paul suggest about Onesimus's separation from Philemon (Philemon 15)?
choice: That it was perhaps for a purpose, that Philemon would have him forever

question: How should Philemon receive Onesimus back (Philemon 16)?
choice: As a beloved brother, more than a slave

question: What does Paul ask Philemon to do if he counts Paul as a partner (Philemon 17)?
choice: To receive Onesimus as he would receive Paul

question: What does Paul offer to do if Onesimus has wronged or owes Philemon anything (Philemon 18)?
choice: To make him work it off
To put that to his own account

question: What does Paul remind Philemon that Philemon owes to him (Philemon 19)?
What does Paul ask Philemon to do for him in the Lord (Philemon 20)?
What is Paul confident that Philemon will do (Philemon 21)?
choice: Obey his request and do even beyond what he says

question: What does Paul request Philemon to prepare for him (Philemon 22)?
Who does Paul mention as a fellow prisoner who sends greetings (Philemon 23)?
Which of these is not mentioned as a fellow worker of Paul (Philemon 24)?
What does Paul wish for Philemon at the end of the letter (Philemon 25)?
choice: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with his spirit
